subject: Re: [junit] Interview with Kent Beck
msgSnippet: ... Welcome, Carol. It looks like you recommended it to the group already. :) -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your guide to software
messageBody:
Carol Beckley wrote:

> Dear Moderator,
>
> In my quest for a robust testing framework, I chanced to read this excellent
> interview<http://www.eclipsemag.net/ecm/ecmcolumns/psecom,id,4,nodeid,6.html
> <http://www.eclipsemag.net/ecm/ecmcolumns/psecom,id,4,nodeid,6.html>>with
> Kent Beck in the Eclipse
> Magazine <http://www.eclipsemag.net/ <http://www.eclipsemag.net/>>. I am
> fascinated by Kent Beck's
> insights on the possibilities that this framework holds in the future. I am
> hooked, which is why I want to be a part of this excellent group. BTW: you
> may also want to recommend Kent's interview as a read for the rest of the
> members on this group. They can download the magazine, free of cost, from
> here:
> http://www.eclipsemag.net/ecm/ecmservices/psecom,id,5,nodeid,4.html
> <http://www.eclipsemag.net/ecm/ecmservices/psecom,id,5,nodeid,4.html>

Welcome, Carol. It looks like you recommended it to the group already. :)
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
